Crimes.Legal_Issue: Can a removal officer defer the execution of a removal order based on a pending humanitarian and compassionate (H&C) application?
Crimes.Application_Facts: Wang overstayed his visa, was denied refugee status, and applied for permanent residence via marriage. His H&C application was pending when he requested deferral of removal.
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: The removal officer's refusal to defer was reasonable; no serious issue exists to justify a stay of removal.
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Stay of removal pending H&C application
Crimes.Court_Ruling: The court dismissed the application for a stay, upholding the removal officer's decision.
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Failed refugee claimant, pending H&C applicant
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Refused to defer removal despite pending H&C application
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Family separation due to marital relationship in Canada
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Removal orders must be executed 'as soon as reasonably practicable'
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Lack of serious risk or harm upon return to country of origin
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Judicial review and motion for stay filed
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Details of marriage, family ties in Canada, lack of risk upon return
Crimes.Application_Basis: Humanitarian and Compassionate considerations based on family life
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Nature and stability of marital relationship, best interests of any children, integration into Canadian society
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Discretion to defer lies with the Minister, exercised through representatives
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: No evidence of danger or exceptional hardship justifying deferral
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Family separation not sufficient to constitute undue hardship under IRPA
Crimes.Cause_Description: Wang's visa expired, leading to a removal order after unsuccessful refugee and PDRCC claims
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Court reviewed submitted H&C application materials
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: No major disputes over evidence authenticity
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Non-compliant – overstayed visa and remained after refugee claim denial
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: H&C factors considered but found insufficient to override enforcement priority
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Pending H&C application does not automatically suspend removal; no exceptional circumstances shown
Crimes.Decision_Making_Body: Removal Officer, Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada

Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to comply with removal order
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Can a removal officer defer the execution of a removal order based on a pending humanitarian and compassionate (H&C) application?
Crimes.Application_Facts: Wang’s refugee claim and PDRCC application were rejected, leading to a removal order. He applied for permanent residence via marriage and sought deferral of removal.
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: The court dismissed Wang's application for a stay, ruling that his H&C application did not present sufficient grounds for deferring the removal order.
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Stay of removal pending H&C application
Crimes.Court_Ruling: The court upheld the removal officer's decision, dismissing Wang's application for a stay and allowing the removal process to proceed.
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Foreign national with failed protection claims and pending H&C application
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Enforcement of removal order without deferral despite ongoing H&C application
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Humanitarian and compassionate grounds based on family separation
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Removal orders must be executed 'as soon as reasonably practicable'; discretion limited
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Absence of threat to personal safety or risk of irreparable harm upon return
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Judicial review and motion for stay filed challenging refusal to defer removal
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Not an issue in this case
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Marriage documentation, family ties in Canada, assessment of conditions in China
Crimes.Application_Basis: Request for deferral based on pending H&C application due to family life
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Strength of family bonds, duration of stay, conduct in Canada, risk upon return
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Discretion to defer removal is narrow and does not extend to all H&C cases
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Insufficient evidence of exceptional circumstances or danger
Crimes.Outcome: Stay denied; removal order remains enforceable
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Family separation acknowledged but not deemed disproportionate or irreparable
Crimes.Cause_Description: Wang’s refugee claim and PDRCC application were rejected, leading to a removal order. He applied for permanent residence via marriage and sought deferral of removal.
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Court examined administrative record and H&C submission
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: Section 48 of the Immigration Act (failure to comply with removal order)
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: No procedural unfairness or evidentiary disputes raised
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Non-compliant – remained in Canada after final removal order
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: H&C factors weighed but found insufficient to justify deferral
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Execution of removal orders takes precedence unless compelling humanitarian risks exist
